summary: The Treasury Department’s Troubled Asset Relief Program was a response to the 2008 financial crisis. Treasury used TARP to distribute hundreds of billions of dollars in assistance to financial institutions and others. TARP had 2 investment programs left as of Sept. 30. The Capital Purchase Program, in which Treasury traded assistance to banks for stock, has received about $227 billion in repayments and income. It...
title: Troubled Asset Relief Program: Status Update on Treasury's Two Active Investment Programs
